sn24.96:3.1: 96 The Self Is Neither Happy Nor Suffering
sn24.96:4.2: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does the view arise:
sn24.96:4.3: ‘The self is neither happy nor suffering, and is sound after death’?”
sn24.96:4.4: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn24.96:5.1: “When form exists, because of grasping form and insisting on form, the view arises:
sn24.96:5.2: ‘The self is neither happy nor suffering, and is sound after death.’
sn24.96:5.6: consciousness exists, because of grasping consciousness and insisting on consciousness, the view arises:
sn24.96:5.7: ‘The self is neither happy nor suffering, and is sound after death.’
sn24.96:6.1: What do you think, mendicants? Is form permanent or impermanent?”
sn24.96:6.3: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn24.96:6.5: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn24.96:6.6: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn24.96:6.13: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn24.96:6.15: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn24.96:6.16: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn24.96:7.1: “So you should truly see any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all form—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn24.96:7.3: You should truly see any kind of feeling …
sn24.96:7.6: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all consciousness—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn24.96:8.1: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
sn24.96:8.4: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn24.96:8.5: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
sn24.96:11.1: The Linked Discourses on views are complete.
